layoutDesc.layout: On the open scroll held in both hands by the figure

handDesc.handNote: Black majuscule letters against white background. Character size varies. Mu with the central strokes reminiscent of an upsilon on a stem; xi with upper part with a straight diagonal spine, and lower part with a curvilinear spine; top bar with serif to the left. In line 2, sigma with an inward-curving spine along its main stroke. In line 10, upsilon on a crossed stem; omega formed of two linked round bowls, each with an inward-curving spine. ΟΥ, ΝΗ joined in ligature. Systematic use of triangular serifs. Lines are ruled top and bottom. Accents and square breathings systematic.

origin.origPlace: Koutsoventis, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Holy Trinity chapel

history.provenance: Not accessible; located in a Turkish military zone in occupied north Cyprus. Studied and photographed in 1969.
